content.question: The simile in lines 21-22 (“like . . . subtitles”) primarily serves to illustrate

choices.label: how crucial the word “like” is to people’s ability to communicate with each other
how the word “like” must be combined with gestures to make its meaning clear in conversation
how the constant use of the word “like” can make English sound like a foreign language
how the use of the word “like” and its equivalents is common to many cultures

content.answer: how crucial the word “like” is to people’s ability to communicate with each other

skill.text: Skill 6.A: Identify and explain the function of a simile.
